sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些副词均含"几乎不"之意。
means: hardly ： 指接近最低限度，差不多没有多余，强调困难和程度。
scarcely ： 指不太充分，不太够，不足，不能令人满意，强调数量。
barely ： 指仅仅够，一点不多，强调没有多余。

sentence.Network_en: The ward was busy and Amy hardly had time to talk.
sentence.Network_cn: 病房里非常忙碌，埃米几乎没有时间说话。

sentence.Network_en: My eyes were so swollen I could hardly see.
sentence.Network_cn: 我的眼睛肿得很厉害，几乎看不到东西。

sentence.Network_en: Their two faces were hardly more than eighteen inches apart.
sentence.Network_cn: 他俩的脸相隔还不到18英寸。

lj.lj_ls: 他们几乎连一本书都没有卖掉。

encyclopedia.content: 副词ad. 1. 几乎不，简直不 My legs were so weak that I could hardlystand. 我的腿虚弱得简直无法站立。 2.不十分；尽，刚 He had hardlyarrived when it began to snow. 他一到，天就下起雪来了。 3.【婉】不 4.艰难地

entry.tran: （用于修正作出的陈述，表示不大可能）几乎不，几乎没有
entry.def: You use hardly to modify a statement when you want to emphasize that it is only a small amount or detail which makes it true, and that therefore it is best to consider the opposite statement as being true.

example.ex: Nick, on the sofa, hardly slept...
example.tran: 尼克在沙发上几乎没睡。

entry.def: You use hardly in expressions such as hardly ever ,hardly any, and hardly anyone to mean almost never, almost none, or almost no-one.

example.ex: We ate chips every night, but hardly ever had fish...
example.tran: 我们每晚吃炸薯条，但几乎从不吃鱼。

example.ex: Most of the others were so young they had hardly any experience...
example.tran: 其他人大多都很年轻，几乎没什么经验。

entry.tran: （用在否定句中构成双重否定，用于强调某事属实或经常发生）几乎不
entry.def: You use hardly before a negative statement in order to emphasize that something is usually true or usually happens.

example.ex: Hardly a day goes by without a visit from someone.

entry.def: When you say you can hardly do something, you are emphasizing that it is very difficult for you to do it.

example.ex: I can hardly believe it's been over eight years since you used to go camping at Cedar Creek...
example.tran: 我几乎无法相信现在距离你过去常常去松溪露营的日子已经有8年多了。

example.ex: My garden was covered with so many butterflies that I could hardly see the flowers.
example.tran: 我的花园里飞舞着很多蝴蝶，我几乎看不见花了。

entry.tran: （表示两件事情紧接着发生）刚刚，才
entry.def: If you say hardly had one thing happened when something else happened, you mean that the first event was followed immediately by the second.

example.ex: He had hardly collected the papers on his desk when the door burst open...
example.tran: 他刚收起桌上的文件，门就猛地开了。

example.ex: Hardly had he returned to London when an anonymous well-wisher called to say he was about to be raided by Customs & Excise.
example.tran: 他刚回到伦敦，就有一个不愿透露姓名的好心人打来电话说，他即将面临海关的突击检查。

entry.tran: （表示希望听者或读者赞同自己）并不，丝毫不
entry.def: You use hardly to mean 'not' when you want to suggest that you are expecting your listener or reader to agree with your comment.

example.ex: We have not seen the letter, so we can hardly comment on it...
example.tran: 我们还没有看到这封信，所以无从发表意见。

example.ex: It's hardly surprising his ideas didn't catch on...
example.tran: 他的想法没有被广泛接受，这并不足为奇。

entry.tran: （尤用于对不赞同的说法表示惊奇或不满）不可能，不会吧
entry.def: You use 'hardly' to mean 'no', especially when you want to express surprise or annoyance at a statement that you disagree with.

example.ex: 'They all thought you were marvellous!' —'Well, hardly.'...
example.tran: “他们都认为你很棒！”“哦，不可能吧！”

example.ex: 'We could almost have seen it,' — 'Hardly, darling — in the dark and from a distance of a good hundred feet?'
example.tran: “我们几乎都看到它了。”“不会吧，亲爱的——天那么黑，离得又至少有100英尺呢！”

sentences.sentence: "had scarcely rung the bell when the door flew open"
"would have scarce arrived before she would have found some excuse to leave"- W.B.Yeats
"he was hardly more than sixteen years old"
"they scarcely ever used the emergency generator"

stems_affixes.word_buile: hard硬,艰难+y……的→adj.强壮的,耐劳的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 刚刚, 几乎不, 仅, 严厉的, 艰辛的

hard硬,艰难+en表动词→v.使变硬 v.变硬

Sentence.sentence: Although it hardly seems practical to trick ourselves into eating less.
I'm so tired. I can hardly see straight.
We conform ( 遵守) to norms so readily that we are hardly aware they exist
This is hardly revolutionary, but it is presented in a charming format.
And most of the time they hardly slowed her down.
And we are rushing to meet so many deadlines that we hardly register that what we need most are lifelines.

sentences.en: I'm so tired that I can hardly walk.
sentences.cn: 我太累, 简直走不动了。

sentences.en: I have got hardly any money.
We had hardly started before[when] it began to rain.
sentences.cn: 我们刚出发, 就开始下雨。

jushi.english: Cathy felt unfair because she was hardly treated by the teacher.
jushi.chinese: 凯西觉得很不公平,因为她受到老师严厉的对待。

jushi.english: I could hardly wait to hear the news.
jushi.chinese: 我迫不及待地要听这消息。

jushi.english: You can hardly expect me to lend you money again.
jushi.chinese: 你别指望我再借钱给你。
